title: E-Invoicing Mandates for 2026
content:
The GST Council has announced mandatory e-invoicing for all B2B transactions starting April 2026, aimed at enhancing transparency and reducing tax evasion. This applies to businesses with an annual turnover above â‚¹5 crore.

E-invoicing requires generating invoices through the GST portal, which assigns a unique Invoice Reference Number (IRN). This streamlines input tax credit reconciliation and reduces manual errors. For detailed guidelines, visit [GST Portal](https://www.gst.gov.in).

Businesses must upgrade their accounting systems to integrate with the GST Network API. Small businesses may face challenges in compliance due to technology costs. Our team at Jayadeva & Co. offers comprehensive support for system integration.

We recommend starting the transition early to avoid penalties. Contact us to assess your readiness and implement e-invoicing solutions.

This mandate also aligns with global digital tax trends, positioning India as a leader in tax automation.
